intro: Pergularia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas. Due to its adaptability, it can become invasive in certain environments.
